result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Lacey M Huckbody was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: Good faith effort to obtain/maintain fulltime employment/school or combination thereof.

Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
Upon successful completion of probation and successful completion of DEJ, defendant may petition Court for expungement. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

ADDRESS INFO for Lacey M Huckbody
Current: 510 1/2 Prospect Apt C, Wausau, WI 54403 United States  (Effective: 01-09-2015)

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 9:11am
State appears by ADA K.Mayo.  Def appears in person and with Atty Robin Kennedy.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. DEJ agreement filed; Waiver of Prelim. filed.
  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.

State moves to:
Ct. 1  (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place)>>DR&I
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA: 
Ct. 2 (Poss w/Intent THC/PTAC)>>GUILTY
Ct. 3 (Poss Para/PTAC)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, defendant guilty on COUNT 3 ONLY.

On COUNT 3>>Sentence W/held; 1 year probation
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; Absolute sobriety; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof; CC.

On COUNT 2>>COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 18 months for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct. 2.

>>Upon successful completion of probation and successful completion of DEJ, defendant may petition COURT for expungement.
DEOJ RH on Count 2>> 7/8/16 at 8:30am
Bond continues.

records.addlTxt: Shall not consume alcohol. Absolute sobriety or unless valid prescription for meds. Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 for Day report. No controlled substances without valid prescription and only in the amount prescribed. No contact with victim(s): D.M.
